meta.description:
Imagine a futuristic transportation network connecting 9 bustling sectors of a newly established colony on Mars, where each sector specializes in different aspects of Martian life, from agriculture to tech development. The network is designed to transport vital resources, such as water, food, and technology, from the colony's central supply hub (Sector 0) to its farthest outpost (Sector 8). The sectors are interconnected through a series of high-speed transport tubes, each with a specific capacity for carrying resources per Martian day.

The capacity for resource flow from one sector to another is as follows:

- From Sector 0 (Central Supply Hub): Can send resources to Sector 1 (7 units), Sector 2 (4 units), Sector 3 (17 units), Sector 4 (4 units), Sector 5 (18 units), Sector 6 (17 units), Sector 7 (5 units), and Sector 8 (14 units).
- From Sector 1: Can send resources to Sector 0 (2 units), Sector 2 (11 units), Sector 3 (10 units), Sector 4 (1 unit), Sector 5 (19 units), Sector 6 (6 units), Sector 7 (16 units), and Sector 8 (13 units).
- From Sector 2: Can send resources to Sector 0 (8 units), Sector 1 (15 units), Sector 3 (5 units), Sector 4 (1 unit), Sector 5 (5 units), Sector 6 (11 units), Sector 7 (17 units), and Sector 8 (18 units).
- From Sector 3: Can send resources to Sector 0 (2 units), Sector 1 (5 units), Sector 4 (6 units), Sector 5 (17 units), Sector 6 (1 unit), Sector 7 (16 units), and Sector 8 (14 units).
- From Sector 4: Can send resources to Sector 0 (15 units), Sector 1 (6 units), Sector 2 (20 units), Sector 3 (15 units), Sector 5 (7 units), Sector 6 (13 units), Sector 7 (6 units), and Sector 8 (19 units).
- From Sector 5: Can send resources to Sector 0 (15 units), Sector 1 (2 units), Sector 2 (8 units), Sector 3 (2 units), Sector 4 (3 units), Sector 6 (2 units), Sector 7 (9 units), and Sector 8 (2 units).
- From Sector 6: Can send resources to Sector 0 (10 units), Sector 1 (12 units), Sector 2 (11 units), Sector 3 (10 units), Sector 4 (19 units), Sector 5 (9 units), Sector 7 (17 units), and Sector 8 (1 unit).
- From Sector 7: Can send resources to Sector 0 (0 units), Sector 1 (20 units), Sector 2 (15 units), Sector 3 (19 units), Sector 4 (20 units), Sector 5 (18 units), Sector 6 (14 units), and Sector 8 (8 units).
- From Sector 8 (Farthest Outpost): Can send resources back to Sector 0 (16 units), Sector 1 (13 units), Sector 2 (3 units), Sector 3 (3 units), Sector 4 (20 units), Sector 5 (19 units), Sector 6 (2 units), and Sector 7 (7 units).

In this Martian colony, a capacity of "0" means there is no direct transport tube connection between those two sectors.

Your task is to calculate the maximum amount of resources that can be transported from the Central Supply Hub (Sector 0) to the Farthest Outpost (Sector 8) per Martian day, ensuring that the flow through each transport tube does not exceed its specified capacity. What is the maximum amount of resources that can be sent from the Central Supply Hub to the Farthest Outpost in units per Martian day?

params.name: capacity
params.description: Capacity of transport tubes between sectors

objective.name: max_flow
objective.description: Maximize the flow from Sector 0 to Sector 8

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_1
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 1

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_2
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 2

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_3
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 3

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_4
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 4

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_5
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 5

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_6
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 6

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_7
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 7

constraints.name: capacity_constraint_0_8
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for flow from Sector 0 to Sector 8

constraints.name: flow_conservation_1
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['1'] for j in Sectors if j != '1') + quicksum(flow[i]['1'] for i in Sectors if i != '1')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['1'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '1') + quicksum(flow[i]['1'] for i in Sectors if i != '1')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_2
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['2'] for j in Sectors if j != '2') + quicksum(flow[i]['2'] for i in Sectors if i != '2')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['2'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '2') + quicksum(flow[i]['2'] for i in Sectors if i != '2')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_3
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['3'] for j in Sectors if j != '3') + quicksum(flow[i]['3'] for i in Sectors if i != '3')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['3'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '3') + quicksum(flow[i]['3'] for i in Sectors if i != '3')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_4
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['4'] for j in Sectors if j != '4') + quicksum(flow[i]['4'] for i in Sectors if i != '4')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['4'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '4') + quicksum(flow[i]['4'] for i in Sectors if i != '4')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_5
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['5'] for j in Sectors if j != '5') + quicksum(flow[i]['5'] for i in Sectors if i != '5')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['5'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '5') + quicksum(flow[i]['5'] for i in Sectors if i != '5')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_6
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['6'] for j in Sectors if j != '6') + quicksum(flow[i]['6'] for i in Sectors if i != '6')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['6'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '6') + quicksum(flow[i]['6'] for i in Sectors if i != '6')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_7
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['7'] for j in Sectors if j != '7') + quicksum(flow[i]['7'] for i in Sectors if i != '7')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['7'][j] for j in Sectors if j != '7') + quicksum(flow[i]['7'] for i in Sectors if i != '7')
